p: . For φ (survival), the best approximating model allowed survival to vary annually for adults but not first‐year birds, for which survival was modeled as a constant (QAIC c ω = 0.84; Table 1). Annual survival of adult females ranged from 0.50 ± 0.05 to 1.00 ± 0.00 (Figure 3), and mean first‐year survival was 0.22 ± 0.02. The second best‐approximating model included an age*year interaction term and had a substantially lower model likelihood (QAIC c ω = 0.14). The third best‐supported model indicated a quadratic relationship between survival and number of extreme ice days per year (days with >95% sea ice cover).
